item.title: Using Vim for a week!
item.description: Starting today, I have decided to be a masochist and use Vim for a week

item.title: LeetCode Blind 19/75: Word Break
item.description: Given a string s and a dictionary of strings wordDict, return true if s can be segmented into a space-separated sequence of one or more dictionary words.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 18/75: Longest Common Subsequence
item.description: Given two strings text1 and text2, return the length of their longest common subsequence. If there is no common subsequence, return 0.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 17/75: Longest Increasing Subsequence
item.description: Given an integer array nums, return the length of the longest strictly increasing subsequence.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 16/75: Coin Change
item.description: Return the fewest number of coins that you need to make up that amount. If that amount of money cannot be made up by any combination of the coins, return -1.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 15/75: Climbing Stairs
item.description: In how many distinct ways can you climb to the top?

item.title: LeetCode Blind 14/75: Reverse Bits
item.description: Reverse bits of a given 32 bits unsigned integer.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 13/75: Missing Number
item.description: Given an array nums containing n distinct numbers in the range [0, n], return the only number in the range that is missing from the array.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 12/75: Counting Bits
item.description: Given an integer n, return an array ans of length n + 1 such that for each i (0 <= i <= n), ans[i] is the number of 1's in the binary representation of i.

item.title: Error Handling in Rust
item.description: Expressing errors, propagating them and creating custom error types.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 11/75: Number of 1 Bits
item.description: Write a function that takes an unsigned integer and returns the number of '1' bits it has (also known as the Hamming weight).

item.title: LeetCode Blind 10/75: Container with most water
item.description: Find two lines that together with the x-axis form a container, such that the container contains the most water.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 9/75: 3Sum
item.description: Given an integer array nums, return all the triplets [nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]] such that i != j, i != k, and j != k, and nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 8/75: Search in Rotated Sorted Array
item.description: Given the array nums after the possible rotation and an integer target, return the index of target if it is in nums, or -1 if it is not in nums.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 7/75: Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array
item.description: Given the sorted rotated array nums of unique elements, return the minimum element of this array.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 6/75: Maximum Product Subarray
item.description: Given an integer array nums, find the contiguous subarray (containing at least one number) which has the largest product and return its product.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 5/75: Maximum Subarray
item.description: Given an integer array nums, find the contiguous subarray (containing at least one number) which has the largest sum and return its sum.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 4/75: Product of Array Except Self
item.description: Given an integer array nums, return an array answer such that answer[i] is equal to the product of all the elements of nums except nums[i].

item.title: LeetCode Blind 3/75: Contains Duplicates
item.description: Given an integer array nums, return true if any value appears at least twice in the array, and return false if every element is distinct.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 2/75: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
item.description: You want to maximize your profit by choosing a single day to buy one stock and choosing a different day in the future to sell that stock.

item.title: LeetCode Blind 1/75: Two Sum
item.description: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target , return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

item.title: Hey there!
item.description: I am an adventurer! It's a pretty good title for someone who has no idea what they're doing. Fancy seeing you here, adventurer as well eh?

item.title: Projects
item.description: Chat Application A secure Django based chat application with websocket authentication Emoji Match Minimalist desktop application to match two emojis built with C# Local Library Node.js(Express) library management web application with MongoDB Read Random Wiki A webapp to generate random wikipedia articles
